definition: after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The people who have survived the disaster usually have a better understanding of life.
sentences.chinese: 劫后余生的人们通常对生命的理解更深刻。

sentences.english: Those who have survived realize the meaning of life .
sentences.chinese: 那些劫后余生大难不死的人，认识到了生命的意义。

sentences.english: He has come through two world wars.
sentences.chinese: 他身经两次世界大战，劫后余生。

sentences.english: Koch began giving spectacularly large donations to the arts and sciences.
sentences.chinese: 劫后余生的科赫开始在艺术和科学领域大额捐款。

definition: mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
lit. if the rabbit dies, the fox grieves (idiom); fig. to have sympathy with a like-minded person in distress
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
lingering fear/fear after the event/post-traumatic stress
